OOC: me too.

Richard Allen <roborick007@...> wrote:OOC: I'm ok with it as long as the effects are short term.

Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote: The phoenix bot lifted himself above most of the shots, but some still
hit, although they were only surface shots. He sent a rain of small
light beams down on the Predacon, but also a pair of explosive feather
shards aimed straight at his wings.

*****************************

OOC: Bots affected by Dread's ability should feel a deep fear and act
either totally frenzied or unable to move. I'd still like to know if
my co-council members feel this is an acceptable power or not, though.
I'll reply after they give me their opinion.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "airly2000" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Hydras:
> 
> "It would be apleasure" replied hydras who shot 25 times against 
> Tylrael
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Tyrael grabs a feather shard and readies himself for the Wolf bot.
> > Unless he can fly, Wolfenstein would impale himself on it.
> > 
> > A laser bolt misses him but not by much. He surrounds himself in a
> > protective light shield against the incoming explosion of grenades,
> > then replies with a massive blast of his own that would have shaken
> > even Fortress Maximus.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Out of my way, lackeys! You have not proved yourselves 
> worthy
> > of my skills. I will fight no one else than your leader today!
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > 
> > > Darkangel aligns himself for a shot from the air and releases four
> > plasma charges at Maxima.
> > > 
> > > : : Wolfenstein : :
> > > 
> > > Wolfenstein leaped in wolf mode, attemting to tackle Tyrael before
> > he could harm Hydras.
> > > 
> > > Wolfenstein: You havn't shown your worthyness to fight the
> > commander, you'll deal with me.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Tyrael grinned grimly.
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: Today is your last day, renegades...
> > > 
> > > Dreadplague took flight, transforming to her menacing wyvern 
> mode. Her
> > > black scaly body was like a bad omen for the defenders. She 
> turned her
> > > head and saw Perceptor... Pathetic fool, she thought. Then, she
> > > focused her mind on him and stirred up all the fears he had deep 
> down,
> > > but mostly the feeling of despair that comes before death.
> > > 
> > > She closed in and readied her talons...
> > > 
> > > Tyrael, though, shot once at Maxima then went for Hydras at a 
> stunning
> > > speed. He did not seem like it, but he matched his enemy on all
> > > points. He intended for Hydras to know he was out for him.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> > > > In a message dated 7/1/03 6:37:58 PM Central Daylight Time, 
> > > > airly2002@h... writes:
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > > "Tripedocus want play with us, my dear"hissed Hidras "And I'm
> > willing 
> > > > > to play with them"
> > > > 
> > > > Following Perceptor out to join the others, she heard Hydras. 
> Her
> > > optics 
> > > > scanning about then turned to look at him. A flash of concern.. 
> but
> > > that soon 
> > > > enough faded. He was the most powerful of all the Cons. There 
> was no
> > > need for 
> > > > concern. Though, there will be a little depending on the 
> situation.
> > > She would 
> > > > still wath her back.. & his! 
> > > > 
> > > > "I don't intend on playing by the rules," she grinned with a 
> wicked
> > > smirk at 
> > > > him. Then turning her attention to the oncoming fire taking 
> cover. 
> > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > > BlackStorm took a weapon and  left the base, looking for a 
> target. 
> > > > > Perceptor did the same
> > > > > 
> > > > > As soon as, BlackStorm left the base, Hydras took a weapon 
> and said 
> > > > > cooly to Maximna "Do you remember your commands about
> > BlackStorm, my 
> > > > > dear?"
> > > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > She looked at him briefly. "Yes. I have the clone created & set.
> > All is 
> > > > ready. It is in a safety chamber." The rifle in her hands as she
> > > turned back to the 
> > > > attackers direction of attack.
